intro.p: The GStreamer team is pleased to announce the first release candidate of the stable 1.12 release series. The 1.12 release series is adding new features on top of the 1.0, 1.2, 1.4, 1.6, 1.8 and 1.10 series and is part of the API and ABI-stable 1.x release series of the GStreamer multimedia framework.
Full release notes will be provided with the 1.12.0 release, highlighting all the new features, bugfixes, performance optimizations and other important changes.
Binaries for Android, iOS, Mac OS X and Windows will be provided in the next days.

No perfectly groomed moustache or any amount of fine clothing is going to cover up the truth - these plugins are Bad with a capital B. They look fine on the outside, and might even appear to get the job done, but at the end of the day they're a black sheep. Without a golden-haired angel to watch over them, they'll probably land in an unmarked grave at the final showdown.

Don't bug us about their quality - exercise your Free Software rights, patch up the offender and send us the patch on the fastest steed you can steal from the Confederates. Because you see, in this world, there's two kinds of people, my friend: those with loaded guns and those who dig. You dig.

This module contains a set of plugins that aren't up to par compared to the rest. They might be close to being good quality, but they're missing something - be it a good code review, some documentation, a set of tests, a real live maintainer, or some actual wide use. If the blanks are filled in they might be upgraded to become part of either gst-plugins-good or gst-plugins-ugly, depending on the other factors. If the plugins break, you can't complain - instead, you can fix the problem and send us a patch, or bribe someone into fixing them for you. New contributors can start here for things to work on.

Other modules containing plugins are:
gst-plugins-base contains a basic set of well-supported plugins gst-plugins-good contains a set of well-supported plugins under our preferred license gst-plugins-ugly contains a set of well-supported plugins, but might pose problems for distributors gst-libav contains a set of codecs plugins based on libav (formerly gst-ffmpeg)

bug.summary: h264parse: process NAL AU DELIMITER
compositor: Segmentation fault
dashdemux: fix default suggestedPresentationDelay
hlsdemux: Add support for EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY-SEQUENCE
[PLUGIN-MOVE] Move rawparse to gst-plugins-base
player: Move to playbin3 and GstStreams API
ttml: Failed assertions with non-conformant input
hlsdemux: Implement adaptivedemux's _stream_seek()
queue2: Avoid return flushing for a not-linked state
ios/osx: Don't use manual reference counting in ObjC code
hls: m3u8: Fix leak on _master_playlist_unref()
Applemedia/AVFVideoSource: Add support for position, device type, and device orientation
hlsdemux: Fix checking bit for adaptation_field_control field to parse pcr
gl: Add support for Vivante EGL FB windowing system
hlsdemux: Try to find type at the end of a fragment
glupload: Add support for Vivante DirectTexture uploads
h264parse: Include `interlace-mode` in caps
tsdemux: Probably broken code, compiler warning with gcc 7
Regression: smoothstreaming live seeking and duration
gst-player: fix gst-player failed to load external subtitle uri
waylandsink: add offset setting for multiplane dmabuf
h264parse (baseparse?) fail to pass not-linked upstream sometimes
shmsrc: do not exit prematurely when polling
glupload: fix GValue leak
gstglformat.c fails to compile with a warning.
dashdemux: invalid enum conversion in SIDX seek error handling
m3u8: Fix parsing EXT-X-DISCONTINUITY
m3u8: Release m3u8 lock if consistent checking failed
Intermittent compile failure libgstgl
decklinkvideosrc: Add no-signal property
